context.p: To check your document for spelling mistakesspellcheck, do the following:

info.p: To run the Spell Checker, do one of the following:

choice.p: Click the Check Spelling button on the toolbar.

stepresult.p: If there are no spelling mistakes in the document, the following message will appear:
If a spelling mistake is found, the Spell Check Dialog will appear showing you the misspelled word and suggesting correct variants:

info.p: The default spelling dictionary is English. To check spelling against another dictionary, select the dictionary from the Language drop-down list.

note.p: Serna comes with English dictionaries only (default, US, GB, and Canadian). You can add more dictionaries to the list.

step.cmd: Choose what to do with the misspelled word.

info.p: In the Spell Check Dialog, do one of the following:

li.p: To ignore the current instance of the word, click the Ignore button.
To ignore all occurrences of the word in the document, click the Ignore All button.
To ignore any error found in the current element, click the Skip Element button.
To correct the current instance of the word, click the Change button.
To correct all occurrences of the word in the document, click the Change All button.

note.p: You can select any of the suggested variants from the Suggestions list.

substep.cmd: Add the word to the dictionary.

info.p: To add the word to the current dictionary, click the Add button.
